data.name: Potato Party: Hash It Out
data.description:
Welcome, friends, to POTATOPIA — where you can finally paint your mashterpiece.

In this quick-draw multiplayer game, it's YOU (the VR potato) against YOUR FRIENDS (iOS and Android potatoes), as they race to be the first to guess what you're drawing in three dimensions.

Up to 8 players can join using the free mobile app on iOS and Android. Watch the VR potato draw on your device or on a stream, input custom prompts, make your guesses, and use special powers to foil your fellow future french fries!

As the VR potato, choose your medium — 3D shapes, air-painting, or canvas drawing — to dazzle your fellow spuds with your artistic prowess.

Draw your worst, guess your best — just don't eat the artist. Please.

changelog.change_log:
Hotfix for two issues: 
 - Fixed a bug where VR player would sometimes get stuck in finalvictory state at the end of a game 
 - Fixed a bug that would sometimes break air-drawing ability

Features added:
- Shape modification! Alongside uniform scaling, players can now scale shapes along specific axes.
- New control scheme! Drawing is now controlled by trigger, and shapes can now be picked up with both grip AND trigger. 
- Beta support for Valve Index headset! You will no longer be drawing all over the place accidentally. Full Index support in progress -- we'd love to hear your feedback.
- Room rearrangement! We Marie Kondo'd away the easel during menu scenes, and moved other furniture for better UX.
- Better, smoother rendering of drawn lines
- You can now draw on the canvas with the finger brush
- New and improved potato models and animations
- Anti-aliasing now active on VR
- Revamped mobile round victory screens
- Iterated on the projectile (onion bomb) mobile powerup
- Drawing now has up to 6 different sizes to choose from

Bugs fixed:
- Improvements to in-game push to talk, including more reliable support for Rift and Vive microphones
- General improvements to collision detection and drawing in VR
- Sound settings now scale better from 0 to 100
- Artist hands and body now properly synced across the network
- Tutorial wording and polish
- Fixed bugs related to Artist winning/losing a round
- Fixed inconsistent collisioning with the totem rollers
- Projectile powerup does not destroy shapes on the bench
